notes: The "LSIB Geographic Thesaurus" enables integration of multiple datasets across different country codes, including the [FIPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FIPS_country_codes) and [ISO](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) standard codes.  This geographic thesaurus streamlines integration of datasets from multiple sources.  This thesaurus includes the following codes: [FIPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FIPS_country_codes), [ISO Alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2), [ISO Alpha-3](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3), [ISO Numeric](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_numeric), [NATO Stanag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NATO_country_codes), and [ccTLD](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code_top-level_domain).  Although this thesaurus was compiled by the [U.S. Department of State, Humanitarian Information Unit](https://hiu.state.gov/), the codes themselves are managed by their respective organizations.  The data contained herein is entirely unclassified and is current as of 20 March 2015. The data is updated as needed.
